intro: Talinum lanceolatum, commonly known as red-rooted morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other morning glories. Talinum lanceolatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
